title: Verisae Shares Expert Insight in Environmental Leader 2015 Insider Knowledge Report
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/24/2015 @ 3:00 AM   Verisae 
MINNEAPOLIS -- (BUSINESS WIRE) -- Implementing modern facility management tools empowers businesses to better monitor performance, analyze efficiency and identify opportunities for cost savings and operational improvements. The challenge is ensuring facility managers have the necessary information available when selecting a connected maintenance and energy management system. Verisae , the company delivering always-on solutions for facility and field service managers across industries, was selected to provide expert insight in Environmental Leader’s 2015 Insider Knowledge Report. The knowledge shared by Bob Tuttle, EVP Field Operations at Verisae, is featured alongside commentary from executives at Best Buy, Bloomberg, General Motors, Hormel Foods and more than 100 other thought-leaders. 
In the report Tuttle details the importance of adopting solutions for asset maintenance and management which ultimately facilitate smooth business operations. Connecting all aspects of facility management creates actionable data and improved decision-making capabilities by assimilating people, processes, and information. 
“Bob has always been at the forefront of technology and intelligence in facilities management, and it’s good to see his expertise recognized in Environmental Leader’s esteemed annual Insider Knowledge report,” said Jerry Dolinsky, CEO, Verisae. “The comments shared in the report are a direct reflection of the leadership role Bob has played at Verisae and the knowledge and expertise that he, and the rest of the Verisae team, provides to our customers.” 
As part of his best practice recommendations, Tuttle shares the five elements that Verisae and its customers have found to be the most important items to consider when executing a connected maintenance and service network. 
“With the advent of Big Data and the Internet of Things, facilities management professionals need to be well-equipped to make the best use of these technologies as they work to better monitor the performance and analyze the efficiency of their operations,” said Tuttle. “My goal in providing this feedback is to ensure these individuals have the information necessary to make those decisions.” 
This is the fifth edition of Environmental Leader’s Insider Knowledge Report and is available for download at www.environmentalleader.com . 
About Verisae 
Verisae’s software technology brings together the concepts of Big Data, machine-to-machine communications and mobile technology to deliver solutions for companies in retail, utilities, telecommunications, and service management industries. Verisae analyzes data to provide predictive, prescriptive and proactive maintenance and management. Operating on an open API technology platform, Verisae’s solutions are simple, integrated and mobile. Backed by Marlin Equity Partners, a $3 billion private equity firm, Verisae has a network of more than 180,000 registered users managing in excess of three million assets at more than 370,000 sites in North America, Europe, and Asia.
